required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Image Supported Lead Placement in CRT
clinical_study.official_title: Advanced Image Supported Lead Placement in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy

collaborator.agency: ZonMw: The Netherlands Organisation for Health Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) is an established pacemaker therapy for patients with symptomatic chronic heart failure, but is hampered by a non-response rate of 30-40%. Optimising left ventricular (LV) lead placement is the cornerstone of improving treatment. The optimal location for the lead is remote from scar but within segments demonstrating late electromechanical activation. The present study aims to investigate the efficacy and clinical effect of the use of real-time guided lead placement using cardiac MRI and fluoroscopy in a blinded, multicenter, randomized controlled trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in % of patients with succesfull LV lead location
primary_outcome.description: Lead location, defined as being within, adjacent, or remote from the pre-defined target.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in reverse remodelling and volumetric response
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as the relative decrease in LV end-systolic volume, indexed to body surface area (LVESVi). Response defined as LVESVi-reduction ≥ 15%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: A hierarchical clinical endpoints, combining relative LVESVi-decrease, change in New York Heart Association class, and death at 12 month follow-up.

The value of image-guided lead placement will be investigated in terms of healthcare expenditure revolving heart failure care. This assesment will be based on a previously conducted preliminary economic analysis.

other_outcome.measure: Difference in total implantation procedure time.
other_outcome.description: Compared between both groups. Measured in minutes.

other_outcome.measure: Difference in total fluoroscopy time during procedure.
other_outcome.description: Compared between both groups. Measured in minutes.

other_outcome.measure: Difference in total contrast dose used during procedure.
other_outcome.description: Compared between both groups. Measured in dose area product.

other_outcome.measure: Difference in change in QRS duration
other_outcome.description: Compared between groups and according to LV lead location. Measured in ms.
Compared between groups and according to LV lead location. Measured in μVs.
Compared between groups and according to LV lead location. Measured in ms.
Compared between groups and according to LV lead location. Measured in mV.

other_outcome.measure: Difference in % of patients with disappearance of apical rocking
other_outcome.description: Compared between groups and according to LV lead location. Option to assess other indices of mechanical recoordination.

arm_group.description: Live visualised, fluoroscopy-fused, image-guided, left ventricular lead placement on the basis of avoiding scar and targeting late mechanically activated segments.
Empirical standard-of-care left ventricular lead placement, in line with current CRT implantation guidelines with electrical guiding on the basis of Q-LV sense.

intervention.description: CARTBox performs analysis of cardiac MRI scans. The result is a treatment file that displays optimal targets for left ventricular lead implantation in CRT. This file will be used as an overlay with live fluoroscopy during the implantation procedure in the intervention group.

patient_data.ipd_description: Within legal and ethical limits, deidentified individual clinical trial participant-level data (IPD), generated by our research, can be made available. Upon publication, data will be made available upon reasonable request and in agreement with a collaboration agreement. A data sharing and management plan is provided.
